title: Greggs is giving out 200,000 freebies today - find out how to get yours

High street bakery chain Greggs is giving out thousands of free bakes, but you'll have to be quick to pick one up.

The retailer said it's giving out 200,000 free spicy chicken and pepperoni and cheese and onion bakes until the end of the month - but you only have until midnight on Thursday to find out if you're included.

Under the terms, only a select few will be able to redeem the reward - as it'll be handed to just 200,000 of those with the Greggs Rewards App.

This week, the reward will appear in thousands of accounts - and if you spot the voucher, you have until October 31 this year to redeem it.

It said the "chosen few" will be rewarded based on their account activity in the weeks leading up to the giveaway - ie those who have scanned their app at the checkout in the past few months.

(Image: Greggs)

To redeem the reward, all you need to do is choose your bake - and then tell the team member at the Greggs till point.

The voucher will include a nine digit or QR code which you'll have to scan in branch.

The promotion comes just weeks after Greggs announced plans to extend opening times for people working late.

The company said it would bring hot takeaway options to 500 stores and keep them open until 9pm.

Under the changes, a new meal deal will be introduced from 4pm - allowing you to pick up a hot dinner main, wedges and a drink for £4.

Or, for half that amount, you can get any pizza and drink for £2 after 4pm - or any hot sandwich, wedges and drink for £4.

"The menu aims to satisfy those on-the-go at dinnertime, looking for value, convenience and of course, great taste," Greggs said in a statement.

(Image: PA)

Greggs, founded as a Tyneside bakery in 1939, is preparing to open its 2,000th shop in the coming weeks.

At the current run rate, it is opening 100 new outlets a year, creating 1,000 jobs by annum, with plans to hit 2,500 within five years.

“We have definitely not hit peak Greggs,” Boss Roger Whiteside said.

Part of Greggs’ success has been its big push into food-on-the-go and breakfasts.

In July, Whiteside said it has now overtaken Starbucks as Britain’s third biggest coffee chain, after Coast Coffee and McDonald’s.

It is also trialling click and collect to avoid queuing, plus online orders for delivery.

While best known for sausage rolls and cakes, Whiteside said “about a quarter of what we sell is what we would describe as healthy.”
